FuncDef: The display access-ip-number command displays the number of IP addresses for PPP users who log in from a specified interface or a specified board.
CLIs: display access-ip-number { interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } | slot <slot-id> } user-type ppp

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the number of IP addresses for PPP users who log in from a specified interface.
-

Displays the number of IP addresses for PPP users who log in from a specified board.
The value is the board ID of an online forwarding VM.

Indicates that the users logging in are PPP users.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> display access-ip-number interface GigabitEthernet1/0/3.1 user-type ppp
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To display the number of IP addresses for PPP users who log in from a specified interface or a specified slot, run the display access-ip-number command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
